#Text=Derawan
#Text=Derawan is an island , one of the Derawan Islands , off the coast of East Kalimantan , Indonesia
#Text=Get in
#Text=As of May 2015 , Sriwijaya Air flies to Berau from Jakarta directly .
#Text=Starting on June 8 , 2015 , Kalstar will also fly to Berau from Jakarta and Surabaya directly .
#Text=Both airlines are medium-service airlines .
#Text=The only international airport in East Kalimantan is Sepinggan at Balikpapan .
#Text=From Balikpapan you can go to Tarakan or Berau on a smaller plane , but there is no flight from Balikpapan to Derawan .
#Text=Although Tarakan is farther from Balikpapapan than Berau , with a bigger airplane , a ticket from Balikpapan to Tarakan is cheaper than one to Berau .
#Text=There are direct flights from Jakarta to Tarakan .
#Text=Direct flights from Jakarta or Surabaya to Berau are the least time-consuming option with only 2 hours .
#Text=The new Maratua Airport does not have scheduled flights yet ( as of February 2017 ) .
#Text=Alternatively , if you choose to go to Tarakan , you must continue the journey with 3 - 4 hours across the sea by speed boat .
#Text=To charter a boat costs , according to the men in the pier , 3.000.000 IDR per boat , final price depends on how many people are joining .
#Text=From the pier Pelabuhan Tegkayu there is a boat departing on Thursdays to Derawan and returning on Sundays operated by the agency Paguntaka Jaya for 300.000 IDR ( as of March 2019 ) .
#Text=You should make arrangements with Mr. Ivan to check for availability ( Contact Number +6281258790176 ) .
#Text=If you choose to go to Berau , you must go to Tanjung Batu first by land transportation ( it 's about 2 hours from Berau ) and then take a 30-minute journey by speed boat to Derawan .
#Text=If you want to go by land transport from Balikpapan , it 's approximately 750 km to Tanjung Batu and then a 30-minute journey by speed boat to Derawan .
#Text=It is a long and hard way .
#Text=It could take 16 - 24 hours because of the condition of the road .
#Text=The route is Balikpapan - Samarinda - Bontang - Sangatta - Muara Wahau - Berau - Tanjung Batu .
#Text=In order to avoid high waves , strong currents and low visibility at sea , the best months for visiting are March to May and August to October .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Darawan
#Text=island is pretty small and you can walk everywhere .
#Text=Many people rent bicycles and scooters to go around - you can rent them in the main road parallel to the west shore of the island .
#Text=Scuba Diving & Snorkeling
#Text=The Derawan Islands have a large number of unique and protected species , among which are the coconut crabs , whales , dolphins and dugongs .
#Text=The coconut crabs are found near the islands of Kakaban and Maratua , while whales and dolphins in particular months can be seen around Semama , Sangalaki , Kakaban and Maratua .
#Text=Dugongs swim around Pulau Panjang and Semama , and manta rays are found around Sangalaki with pygmy seahorses around Semama and Derawan .
#Text=Other protected species are the barracuda .
#Text=There are a total of 28 dive points identified here .
#Text=Avid divers will need at least 10 days to explore them all .
#Text=Diving or snorkeling at Derawan island or for deep sea diving
#Text=Maratua island .
#Text=Famous spot for snorkeling is Manta Spot , where Manta fish can be seen , near Sangalaki island .
#Text=Sharks and sea turtles can be seen at Maratua or Derawan island .
#Text=Derawan Dive Resort , Komp .
#Text=Balikpapan Permai blok G1 No.34 , ☏ +62 542-7072615 .
#Text=Danakan Dive Center .
#Text=Dive center with a nearby lodge for divers Danakan Losmen .
#Text=Offers dive courses , dive trips and introduction dives .
#Text=Equipment is fine , dive masters are local and know where to find everything .

#Text=A trip with 2 divers costs 350.000 IDR each dive ( 1.050.000 for 3 dives ) , but if you want to do them in another island and not in Derawan , you have to add 1.500.000 IDR to charter a small boat for the day .
#Text=These prices do n't include the lunch and in Kakaban or Sangalaki there are no restaurants , so you need to bring your own food .
#Text=Arrange your dives with Mr. Ichuk ( +6282148088672 )
#Text=Cuddle with jellyfishes
#Text=You can cuddle with jellyfishes at Kakaban Island , which has no human inhabitants except for some guards and researchers .
#Text=One kilometer from the beach there is a lake with salt water , but not so salty as seawater .
#Text=The lake has 4 kinds of jellyfishes and none can sting human skin .
#Text=The clear water of lake Kakaban is made easy for snorkellers to cuddle or touch the jellyfishes , and see the biggest kind of jellyfish eat the smaller kind of jellyfish .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There is one bank and ATM on the Derawan Islands , but it only accepts Indonesian cards .
#Text=Make sure to go to the island with enough cash for accommodation , diving and/or snorkelling trips , food and other activities .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Drinks are scarce and expensive in the Derawan Island .
#Text=One can of beer in the shops is around 40.000 IDR .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are many hotels in Derawan .
#Text=The largest one is Derawan Dive Resort managed by PT BMI .
#Text=Other hotels are managed by local citizens .
#Text=If you want to stay on other islands , there are two famous resorts on Maratua island : Nabuko resort and Paradise resort .

#Text=Derawan and Maratua are also popular with domestic tourists , so when there are long holidays ( at least 3 days ) in Indonesia , the hotels and resorts in both islands are fully booked , but homestays with spring beds and air conditioning are still available for Rp 250,000 to Rp 300,000 per night , or you can sleep in Tanjung Batu .
#Text=Kakaban island is a conservation island for jellyfish , so nobody lives there .
#Text=Sangalaki island is for sea turtle conservation ; only NGO people live there .
#Text=By air
#Text=Jakarta
#Text=Surabaya
#Text=Balikpapan
#Text=Tarakan
